alert.note: Alert for Elbert (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 07 at 5:24PM EDT until August 07 at 6:15PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: The National Weather Service in Greenville-Spartanburg has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southeastern Elbert County in northeastern Georgia... Southern Laurens County in Upstate South Carolina... Southeastern Abbeville County in Upstate South Carolina... Greenwood County in Upstate South Carolina... * Until 615 PM EDT. * At 524 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 6 miles west of Laurens to 6 miles northwest of Greenwood to 14 miles southwest of Abbeville, moving southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and power lines. * Locations impacted include... Greenwood, Laurens, Abbeville, Clinton, Ninety Six, Joanna, Cross Hill, Cokesbury, Waterloo and Hodges. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report damaging winds, hail, or flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, or by posting on our Facebook page, or Tweet it using hashtag nwsgsp. Your message should describe the event and the specific location where it occurred.
